ontology.Title: DBPedia Ontology
ontology.Description: The DBpedia Ontology is a shallow, cross-domain ontology, which has been manually created based on the most commonly used infoboxes within Wikipedia.
ontology.License: Creative Common Attribution, GNU Free Documentation Licsensing

wikipedia.Title: Wikipedia Input files
wikipedia.Description: The wiki input files are the xml source files that are extracted from the Wikipedia dump files
wikipedia.License: Creative Common Attribution, GNU Free Documentation Licsensing

datasets.Title: DBPedia Datasets
datasets.Description: The DBPedia datasets contain triples extracted from the respective Wikipedia, including the ones whose URIs do not have an equivalent Wikidata entry. These are available in two serializations - turtle(ttl) & quad-turtle(tql)
datasets.License: Creative Common Attribution, GNU Free Documentation Licsensing

nlp.Title: NLP Datasets
nlp.Description: The NLP Datasets were created by the DBpedia Spotlight team to support entity recognition and disambiguation tasks, among others. There are four different DBPedia NLP Datasets namely Lexicalization, Topic Signatures, Thematic Concepts and People's Grammatical Genders
nlp.License: Creative Common Attribution, GNU Free Documentation Licsensing

dataid.Title: DBPedia Dataset Metadata as DataIDs
dataid.Description: The metadata for DBPedia datasets is provided in the form of DataIDs for all extracted languages to the respective language directories.
dataid.License: Creative Common Attribution, GNU Free Documentation Licsensing
